required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Examine the Psychosocial Impacts of Covid-19 Pandemic.
clinical_study.official_title: An International Study Examining the Psychosocial Impacts of Covid-19 Pandemic.

collaborator.agency: Ibn Sina University of Medical and Pharmaceutical Sciences, Iraq

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observational study examining the psychosocial impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic in several low-resource countries (Pakistan, Bangladesh, Iraq, Somalia, Indonesia, Malaysia, Turkey) and an English-speaking country (USA). The data will be obtained on the measures of wellbeing (WHO Well-Being Index), psychological distress (Kessler 10), post-traumatic stress (PTSD Checklist for DSM-5), post-traumatic growth (Posttraumatic Growth Inventory), and pandemic-related stress (Covid Psychosocial Impacts Scale). Depending on the context, the data will be collected employing either a unilingual (in native language) or bilingual online survey (with English as a second language) from 500 participants (aged 18 and above) in each of the eight locations using non-probability convenient sampling. Where applicable in some countries (Malaysia, Turkey, and Somalia), a follow-up survey will be repeated in the same cohort, which will provide a comparable data set longitudinally. The findings will enable us to examine the psychosocial impacts of COVID-19; validate the translations of the CPIS and standardized measures; and determine the trajectory of study variables with pandemic exposure.

primary_outcome.measure: Examining the psychosocial impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic.
primary_outcome.time_frame: The time it takes to perform the initial assessment varies, but it usually takes about 9 months. The follow-up longitudinal assessments (Turkey, Somalia) will take an average of two years to complete once the study is completed.
primary_outcome.description: To explore the psychosocial impacts of the Covid-19 pandemic on self-report questionnaires of wellbeing (WHO-5), psychological distress (K10), post-traumatic stress (PCL-5), post-traumatic growth (PTGI), and pandemic-related stress (CPIS) in several low-resource countries and an English-speaking country. The data will be collected employing a unilingual (Indonesia, Bangladesh, Turkey, USA) or bilingual (Pakistan, Malaysia, Iraq, Somalia) survey. Where applicable, a follow-up survey will be repeated longitudinally (Malaysia, Turkey, and Somalia). With-in-subjects and between-subjects designs together with exploratory regression analyses will be employed to characterize this outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Analyzing the reliability of CPIS in another English speaking country where there have been higher rates of COVID-19 infection.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study will take an average of 9 months to complete.
secondary_outcome.description: Although, the validation of the newly developed CPIS has already been examined in New Zealand. But, relatively speaking, New Zealand has fared well and it is desirable to validate the CPIS in a different English-speaking COVID-19 context, where there have been higher rates of COVID-19 infection. The data will be collected employing a one-off unilingual (English) survey in the USA. Several standardized questionnaires of wellbeing (WHO-5, PTGI) and distress (K10, PCL-5) will be employed together with the CPIS to examine validity. The metric used to characterize this outcome involves reliability (internal consistency, test-retest reliability) and validity (convergent, discriminant) analyses.

other_outcome.measure: Analyzing the psychometric properties of the translations of the newly developed CPIS and other standardized measures.
other_outcome.time_frame: The time it takes to perform the initial assessment varies, but it usually takes about 9 months. The follow-up longitudinal assessments (Turkey, Somalia) will take an average of two years to complete.
other_outcome.description: The findings will give psychometric information on the translations and suitability of use of the newly developed CPIS and other standardized questionnaires (K10, WHO-5, PCL-5, PTGI) in several low-resource countries. The findings will help determine the quality of translations and their appropriateness for usage in the target population. The data will be collected employing a unilingual (Indonesia, Bangladesh, Turkey) or bilingual (Pakistan, Malaysia, Iraq, Somalia) survey. Where applicable, a follow-up survey will be repeated longitudinally (Malaysia, Turkey, and Somalia). The metric used to characterize this outcome involves reliability (internal consistency, test-retest reliability) and validity (convergent, discriminant) analyses.

other_outcome.measure: Analyzing the longitudinal trajectory of the psychosocial impacts of the Covid-19 pandemic.
other_outcome.time_frame: The time to complete the study can vary but it will be completed in an average of 2 years.
other_outcome.description: The data will be obtained longitudinally in some countries to understand the trajectory of psychosocial impacts and to examine the degree of changes over time. The data will be collected employing a unilingual (Turkey) or bilingual (Somalia) survey and it will comprise of several self-report questionnaires of wellbeing (WHO-5), psychological distress (K10), post-traumatic stress (PCL-5), post-traumatic growth (PTGI), and newly developed measures of pandemic-related stress (CPIS). A follow-up survey will be repeated longitudinally in the same cohort. The metric used to characterize this outcome involves tabular and graphical measures and the use of linear mixed model analysis.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Examining the psychosocial impacts of Covid-19 in Pakistan.
arm_group.description: This is exploratory research and data will be obtained on a set of measures (N=500) using a one-off bilingual (Urdu-English) survey. No predefined conditions apply to explain the nature of the study group other than inclusion and exclusion criteria.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Examining the psychosocial impacts of Covid-19 in Iraq.
arm_group.description: This is exploratory research and data will be obtained on a set of measures (N=500) using a one-off bilingual (Arabic-English) survey. No predefined conditions apply to explain the nature of the study group other than inclusion and exclusion criteria.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Examining the psychosocial impacts of Covid-19 in Turkey.
arm_group.description: This is exploratory research and data will be obtained on a set of measures (N=500) using a unilingual (Turkish) survey with longitudinal assessment after 3 weeks of initial assessment. No predefined conditions apply to explain the nature of the study group other than inclusion and exclusion criteria.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Examining the psychosocial impacts of Covid-19 in USA.
arm_group.description: This is exploratory research and data will be obtained on a set of measures (N=500) using a one-off unilingual (English) survey. No predefined conditions apply to explain the nature of the study group other than inclusion and exclusion criteria.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Examining the psychosocial impacts of Covid-19 in Bangladesh.
arm_group.description: This is exploratory research and data will be obtained on a set of measures (N=500) using a one-off unilingual (Bangla) survey. No predefined conditions apply to explain the nature of the study group other than inclusion and exclusion criteria.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Examining the psychosocial impacts of Covid-19 in Malaysia.
arm_group.description: This is exploratory research and data will be obtained on a set of measures (N=500) using a bilingual (Malay-English) survey. Data will be obtained longitudinally after 12 months of initial assessment. No predefined conditions apply to explain the nature of the study group other than inclusion and exclusion criteria.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Examining the psychosocial impacts of Covid-19 in Indonesia.
arm_group.description: This is exploratory research and data will be obtained on a set of measures (N=500) using a one-off unilingual (Indonesian) survey. No predefined conditions apply to explain the nature of the study group other than inclusion and exclusion criteria.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Examining the psychosocial impacts of Covid-19 in Somalia.
arm_group.description: This is exploratory research and data will be obtained on a set of measures (N=500) using a one-off bilingual (Somalia-English) longitudinally. No predefined conditions apply to explain the nature of the study group other than inclusion and exclusion criteria.

study_pop.textblock: The participants will be recruited from the general population using convenience sampling in each of the eight locations (Pakistan, Bangladesh, Iraq, Somalia, Indonesia, Malaysia, Turkey, and the USA). The specific details (e.g., residents of a certain town) may vary from country to country and it will be outlined by the international collaborators in local ethics applications. This information will be added to the trial registrations site once obtained.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged 18 and above
- Currently residing in the country of interest.
- Additional inclusion criterion applies to bilingual studies; which is having English as a second language.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Aged below 18 years.
- Not residing in the country of interest.
- Additional exclusion criterion applies to bilingual studies; which is not having English as a second language.
